description: A gloss of uncertain authorship: This copy attributed to Ḥakīm Shāh Muḥammad ibn Mubārak al-Qazwīnī, d. 928/1522 according to Baghdādī, Hadīyat al-ʻārifīn (1951-55), II, 229 (title and authorʼs name appear twice on fol. 1a, inscribed in two triangles ruled in gold, as well as in the colophon). However, a gloss with the same incipit is attributed to Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar al-Jandī (for the nisbah cf. Ibn al-Athīr, Lubāb I, 240sq.) in the following mss.: As. Soc. Bengal 723; Fihris al-kutub al-mawjūdah bi-al-Maktabah al-Azharīyah, III, 181; India Off. 399 and 1937; Sobranie vostochnykh rukopiseĬ Akademii nauk UzbekskoĬ SSR, 3292; cf. Brockelmann, GAL, I, 549 (gloss f); S I, 760 (the ms. Uppsala is anon.). Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, mentions only Ḥakīm Shāhʼs gloss (col. 1146). ff. 75. 208 x 133; 148 x 70 mm. 25 lin. Rabīʻ I, 1169. Incip.: ... قوله الحمد لله الردف التسمىة بالتحمىد لان الفعل لا ىتم ولا ىعتد به شرعا ... قوله بجلال ذاته اى عظمته ىقال جل فلان اذا عظم
title: Ḥāshiyah ʻalá sharḥ al-Taftāzānī.
subject: Taftāzānī, Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar, 1322-1389?—Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
